title: Daily Market Digest
subtitle: February 24, 2026: AI & Tariffs Weigh on Markets, Futures Stabilize

items.headline: Wall Street Stumbles Amid Tariff Hikes and AI Disruption Fears
items.summary: U.S. equity markets closed lower on Monday, driven by President Trump's announcement of increased global tariffs and escalating concerns over the disruptive potential of artificial intelligence. While major indices saw significant declines, futures showed signs of stabilization in early Tuesday trading. Geopolitical tensions involving the US and Iran also contributed to market unease.

items.statContext: Futures for S&P 500, NASDAQ 100, and Dow Jones Industrial Average rose in early Tuesday trading.

items.headline: Keysight Technologies Soars on Strong Earnings
items.summary: Keysight Technologies Inc. ($KEYS) surged after reporting better-than-expected Q1 financial results and issuing strong Q2 guidance.

items.headline: IBM Plunges Amid AI Tool Concerns
items.summary: IBM plunged following the unveiling of new AI-powered coding tools by Anthropic, fueling fears of disruption in the software sector.

items.headline: CrowdStrike Hit by AI Cybersecurity Threat
items.summary: CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. fell sharply as Anthropic's new AI code-scanning tool raised concerns about disruption to the cybersecurity industry.

items.headline: AppLovin Declines on AI Competition Worries
items.summary: AppLovin sank amidst growing worries that AI competition could undercut its customer base and reshape its industry.

items.headline: American Express Down on AI Job Loss Risks
items.summary: American Express declined after research highlighted potential widespread AI-driven job losses impacting financial services.

items.headline: Microsoft Among Tech Leaders Retreating
items.summary: Microsoft Corporation saw a notable drop as tech stocks across the board reacted to market uncertainties.

items.headline: Trump Raises Global Tariffs to 15%, Fueling Market Uncertainty
items.summary: President Trump announced an increase in global tariffs to 15% from 10%, following a Supreme Court ruling that struck down his earlier 'reciprocal' tariffs. This policy shift has fueled risk-off sentiment in asset markets. US Customs and Border Protection confirmed that IEEPA-based tariffs would cease on February 24, 2026, though other tariff regimes remain in effect.

items.headline: AI Disruption Fears Hammer Tech and Software Stocks
items.summary: Concerns over the disruptive power of artificial intelligence significantly impacted tech and software sectors. A report by Citrini Research outlining a future of 'mass white-collar unemployment' due to AI and Anthropic's new AI code-scanning tool intensified these fears, leading to sharp declines in cybersecurity and payment companies.

items.headline: Defensive Sectors Gain as Market Rotates Away from Risk
items.summary: In a clear rotation away from riskier assets, defensive sectors such as Consumer Staples, Health Care, and Utilities showed resilience and led gains. Financials, Communication Services, and Industrials, however, experienced declines. Equity leadership has notably shifted towards 'real, tangible sectors' like Industrials, Energy, and Materials.

items.headline: Fed Outlook Steady, Consumer Confidence Expected to Rise
items.summary: The Federal Reserve is widely expected to keep interest rates unchanged at its March FOMC meeting, though Governor Waller linked future cuts to February labor market data. Meanwhile, the February Dallas Fed manufacturing outlook improved, and the Conference Board's consumer confidence index is projected to climb. 30-year fixed mortgage rates decreased slightly to 6.07%.

items.headline: The Home Depot and Life Time Report Earnings
items.summary: The Home Depot ($HD) announced its Q4 and Fiscal 2025 results, with Q4 sales down 3.8% but fiscal 2025 sales up 3.2%. The company also increased its quarterly dividend by 1.3%. Life Time reported a significant 139.2% increase in net income for Q4 and full-year 2025. Nvidia's earnings report is anticipated on Wednesday.

items.headline: Geopolitical Tensions Mount as US-Iran Nuclear Talks Loom
items.summary: Escalating tensions between the United States and Iran continue to be a source of market anxiety. Nuclear talks between the two nations are scheduled to resume on Thursday in Geneva. In response to global uncertainties, safe-haven assets like gold surged over 2%, reaching $5,227.42.
